title: Man arrested, charged with two counts of attempted murder in Colleton County 21 hours ago
content: Jerrell Mowan Roberts (Provided/Colleton County Sheriff's Office)    Yemassee, S.C. (WCIV) —    A 28-year-old Yemassee man has been arrested, charged with two counts of attempted murder for shooting two men with an assault rifle, according to the Colleton County Sheriff’s Office.     Jerrell Mowan Roberts is accused of shooting Stuart Elliott and Marvis Williams in the area of Jonesville Avenue and Hendersonville Highway last Saturday.    One of the victims was flown to Trident Medical Center in Charleston in critical condition.    Roberts was arrested Thursday. According to an arrest warrant, there is an unnamed second person involved with the shooting.    According to the sheriff’s office, the Colleton County Sheriff’s Dispatch received a 911 reference to a shooting around 6:45 a.m. on May 26.    Upon arrival, two male victims were located with apparent gunshot wounds.    Both victims were transported to the Colleton County Medical Center emergency room.    Investigators arrived at the scene and found multiple shell casings, the sheriff's office says.    A vehicle located at the scene that was in possession of the victims was reported stolen out of Charleston County, the sheriff's office states.    Evidence and eyewitness accounts led investigators to Roberts as a suspect, an arrest warrant states.    Roberts is incarcerated in the Colleton County Detention Center.    His bond was set at $150,000 cash or surety and he must also have Electronic (GPS) Monitor Device attached and operating before being released.    The investigation is ongoing.
